Guerrilla Warfare.name: Guerrilla Warfare
Guerrilla Warfare.blurb: If Teemo stands still and takes no actions for a short duration, he becomes Invisible indefinitely. If he's in brush, Teemo can enter and maintain his Invisibility while moving. After leaving Invisibility, Teemo gains the Element of Surprise, increasing his Attack Speed for 3 seconds.
Guerrilla Warfare.description: Innate: Teemo gains  invisibility if he stands still for 1.5 seconds without acting or being acted upon. He will remain stealthed so long as he does not move or act, and is not  displaced. If within  brush, Teemo gains stealth after 1.5 seconds even while moving and may move freely within its boundaries without breaking stealth.
Guerrilla Warfare.description2: Element of Surprise: When Teemo breaks stealth, he gains the Element of Surprise for 3 seconds, granting him  20 / 40 / 60 / 80% (based on level) bonus attack speed.
Guerrilla Warfare.notes:
* Guerrilla Warfare will not grant Teemo stealth as long as he is taking damage (damage taken once stealthed will not reveal Teemo).
 Teemo will break Guerrilla Warfare's stealth by using certain summoner spells ( Clarity,  Dash,  Exhaust,  Heal,  Ignite,  Mark,  Recall,  Smite,  Teleport) and certain trinkets ( Oracle Lens) but not when placing wards, when using consumable items, or when using  Flash to get within a brush (while already stealthed beforehand).
 If Teemo triggers Element of Surprise twice in less than 3 seconds he will only refresh the bonus attack speed's duration (it will not stack with itself).

Blinding Dart.name: Blinding Dart
Blinding Dart.blurb: Obscures an enemy's vision with a powerful venom, dealing damage to the target unit and blinding it for the duration.
Blinding Dart.description: Active: Teemo shoots a dart at the target enemy, dealing them  magic damage and  blinding them for a short duration.
Blinding Dart.notes:
* Blinding Dart will not make abilities that can trigger on-hit effects ( Parrrley,  Mystic Shot) miss.
 When blinded, enemies have a green tint on their screen.

Move Quick.name: Move Quick
Move Quick.blurb: Teemo scampers around, passively increasing his Movement Speed until he is struck by an enemy champion or turret. Teemo can sprint to gain bonus Movement Speed that isn't stopped by being struck for a short time.
Move Quick.description: Passive: Teemo gains  bonus movement speed if he hasn't taken damage from enemy champions or turrets for 5 seconds.
Move Quick.description2: Active: Teemo doubles his  bonus movement speed for 3 seconds and prevents it from being disabled by damage for the duration.
Move Quick.notes:
* Move Quick's active's cooldown starts when the ability is first cast and not when the duration ends.
 When Move Quick's active bonus movement speed ends Teemo will not regain the passive one if he was damaged during the active's duration.
Move Quick's passive will be disabled even if the damage is blocked with a spell shield.

Toxic Shot.name: Toxic Shot
Toxic Shot.blurb: Each of Teemo's attacks will poison the target, dealing damage on impact and each second after for 4 seconds.
Toxic Shot.description: Passive: Teemo's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and  poison his target.
Toxic Shot.description2: Poisoned targets suffer magic damage for 4 seconds, with subsequent attacks refreshing the  poison's duration.

leveling2.attribute: Total Magic Damage in a Single Hit

Toxic Shot.notes:
* Toxic Shot's poison will trigger  Twin Fang's bonus effects for  Cassiopeia.
 Each tick of damage from Toxic Shot can apply  Hunter Talisman's  damage over time to  monsters.

Noxious Trap.name: Noxious Trap
Noxious Trap.blurb: Teemo throws an explosive poisonous trap using one of the mushrooms stored in his pack. If an enemy steps on the trap, it will release a poisonous cloud, slowing enemies and damaging them over time. If Teemo throws a mushroom onto another mushroom it will bounce, gaining additional range.
Noxious Trap.description: Passive: Teemo stores a Noxious Trap charge periodically, up to a maximum amount at once.
Noxious Trap.description2: Active: Teemo tosses a  mushroom trap on the ground, which stealths and arms after 1 second, lasting up to 5 minutes. While armed, mushrooms grant  sight around them. Mushrooms bounce forward if they land on top of another mushroom. This can happen an infinite amount of times while Teemo is alive. If Teemo dies before the mushroom lands on another mushroom, the mushroom will disappear.
Noxious Trap.description3: If an enemy steps on a mushroom, it detonates,  poisoning all nearby enemies,  slowing them, granting  sight of them, and dealing them magic damage over 4 seconds.
Noxious Trap.description4: Noxious Trap have  6 maximum health and can only be damaged by champion basic attacks (2 damage from  ranged and 3 from  melee).
Noxious Trap.notes:
*  Rift Scuttler will not trigger Noxious Trap's explosion if it is not being attacked.
 Noxious Trap's poison will trigger  Twin Fang's bonus effects for  Cassiopeia.
 Enemies who step on multiple Noxious Traps will only refresh the poison's duration (their damage does not stack).
 Noxious Trap's damage is determined when it detonates and not when planted, meaning if Teemo's  ability power changes, the scaling is also altered to affect all active mushrooms' damage so long as they do not explode.
 Noxious Trap can be targeted by any allied  Teleport. The mushroom will not become invulnerable and its detonation (if the teleportation is already  channeling when so) will not be canceled.
  Spell shield will only block the  poison (self and allied) and the  slow but will not prevent the detonation itself.
 A thrown Noxious Trap will be destroyed when colliding with  Wind Wall /  Unbreakable.
